title: Non Game Event Check In
custom_preconds:
Conditions for a valid check in - user is located within 2km or .9 miles of the ballpark location and within 4 hours of the event start time

**Be sure to test for both check in from Ballpark Guide page and Event details page**

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user meets the conditions for check in at the All Star Sunday event and attempts to check in
custom_steps_separated.expected: User is able to check in successfully

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user does not meet the check in conditions and attempts to check in to All Star Sunday event (check for both time and location mismatch)
custom_steps_separated.expected: User is unable to check in

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user meets the conditions for check in at the Home Run Derby and attempts to check in
custom_steps_separated.expected: User is able to check in successfully

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user does not meet the check in conditions and attempts to check in to Home Run Derby (check for both time and location mismatch)
custom_steps_separated.expected: User is unable to check in

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user meets the conditions for check in at the All Star Game and attempts to check in
custom_steps_separated.expected: User is able to check in successfully

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user does not meet the check in conditions and attempts to check in to the All Star Game (check for both time and location mismatch)
custom_steps_separated.expected: User is unable to check in

title: Veirfy the at bat deep link is working as intended
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the ASG
And the user wants to check out the ASG stats on At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user goes to the BPG page for the ASG
And the user taps on the upcoming event
And the user taps on the At Bat deeplink on the event detail view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be directed to the gameday view for the ASG on At Bat
And the app should not crash
And the app should be able to device back to ballpark without the app crashing

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the BPG page
And the device date is set within the 4 hour window of All-Star Sunday or HR Derby
And the user taps on the upcoming event cell
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the event detail view for All-Star Sunday or HR Derby
And the user will not see the At Bat deeplink

title: All star events flipping correctly
custom_preconds:
Given the user is constantly checking the ballpark app
And the user wants to see when the next event will kick in

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user sets the device date to so the next event is a non-game/all star event
And the user is outside the 4 hour window
And the user navigates to the ballpark guide page for the ballpark
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the next upcoming game as the first non-game event
And the user should be able to navigate to the event detail view for that event
And the user should not be able to check-in to said event

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user sets the device date to the end date/time of the first event or the user set the device date/time to the flip over (9am the next morning)
And the user is on the ballpark guide
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be on ballpark guide
And the user will see the upcoming game cell flip over to the next event

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user sets the device date/time to the ASG
And the user goes the BPG page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the upcoming game cell display the ASG
And the user should be directed to the ASG on the event detail view
And the check-in button should be enabled

custom_steps_separated.content: WHen the user sets the device date/time to the day after or sets it to the flip over time
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the lookup update and pull the next upcoming game for that ballpark

title: Event Details Display
custom_preconds: See https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-2245 for details and designs

custom_steps_separated.content: When the next event at a ballpark is All Star Sunday and the user is on the Ticket Dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the All Star Sunday non game event displayed in the next event module

custom_steps_separated.content: When the next event at a ballpark is Home Run Derby and the user is on the Ticket Dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the Home Run Derby non game event displayed in the next event module

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the Home Game list for the ballpark hosting the All Star events
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the All Star Sunday, Home Run Derby and All Star games on their respective dates with their unique logos and descriptions

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a All Star Sunday or Home Run Derby and views the Ticket Event Details
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will not see any team or All Star logos

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a All Star Game and views the Ticket Event Details
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see AL/NL logos for the home and away team

title: Ticket Support
custom_preconds: When the user has tickets for any of the All Star games or events

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has ticket(s) for any All Star game or event
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the ticket icon in the ballpark picker next to the ballpark hosting the All Star events and on the Ticket Dashboard tab header for that ballpark as well

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has ticket(s) for All Star Sunday and is on the Ticket Dashboard for the ballpark hosting the All Star events
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the All Star Sunday event will be displayed in the My Tickets list with the correct event logo and the number of tickets linked to the account

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has ticket(s) for Home Run Derby and is on the Ticket Dashboard for the ballpark hosting the All Star events
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Home Run Derby will be displayed in the My Tickets list with the correct event logo and the number of tickets linked to the account

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has ticket(s) for All Star Game and is on the Ticket Dashboard for the ballpark hosting the All Star events
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the All Star Game will be displayed in the My Tickets list with the correct event logo and the number of tickets linked to the account

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on My Tickets list
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see in the list any of the All Star Games or events for which they have tickets with the correct logos and descriptions

title: Ticket Forward
custom_preconds: When user has tickets to All Star Sunday, Home Run Derby or All Star Game

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the Ticket Event Detail view for All Star Sunday or Home Run Derby
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the ticket forward button

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps ticket forward button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be on the ticket forward email view and see the event details for All Star Sunday or HRD (no team logos, no away team information)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user user forwards tickets for All Star Sunday or Home Run Derby
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is able to successfully forward the ticket(s)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the scan view of a All Star Sunday or Home Run Derby ticket
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the correct event details, no logo and no away team

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to forward a ticket for the All Star Sunday or Home Derby events
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the use is able to successfully forward the ticket(s)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has forwarded a ticket for ASS or HRD
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the recipient account will have an email and be able to successfully accept the ticket in Ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content: When a ticket forward is accepted for ASS or HRD and forwarding and receiving accounts review the "Ticket Forwards" section Ticket Dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then both accounts will see the recent ticket forwarding transactions under Received and Sent

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on a ticket to All Star Game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the correct AL/NL logos and team information in the scan view

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to forward an All Star Game ticket from either the Ticket Event Details page (via multi forward) or scan view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be able to successfully complete a ticket forward, accept it on another account and review the transaction in the "Ticket Forwards" section of the Ticket Dashboard
